Course Description: This objective of this course is to train students in creation of computing solutions that are relevant to medicine. The course will pick timely and relevant topics in computing such as the building blocks of electronic health records, modeling and visualizing diseases, pathogen and human factors involved in spread and the ever increasing role of information management and computing in managing diseases.

Prerequisites.Mandatory: Any 3rd, 4th year UG, Masters, and Ph.D. student

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students can build interoperable data exchange solutions for medicine and public health
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students can understand and critique existing modeling methods for medical and public health data
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students can produce models for the spread of infectious diseases
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students can Develop new interventions during epidemics and health emergencies

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Computing and Healthcare - The Big Picture (Health Perspective)
Build the National Health Stack: Interoperability, Data Standards (HL7, DICOM, FHIR)
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: HW 1. Tutorial / Workshop on HL7 / DICOM / FHIR

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Anonymization techniques for sharing data between hospitals
Computing the Host and Pathogen Factors for Disease
Agent based models (ABM)s, Epidemics / infectious diseases
Building ABMs for Epidemics like COVID
Managing Infodemic by Identifying and Mitigating Fake News
Managing Infodemic with NLP and Effective Risk Communication

Resource Material.Textbook: All required materials will be provided to students during the semester.
